definition: to have no opportunity/no way (of doing sth)/no chance/no connection/not placed (in a competition)/(in pop lyrics) no chance of love, no place to be together etc
no cause, no reason (idiom); completely uncalled for

sentences.english: It could be just a memory that floats into your head for no reason.
sentences.chinese: 它可以只是一些無緣由的飄過腦海中的記憶罷了。

sentences.english: The cake maker shakes a naked snake with the qusimilarg rake without sake.
sentences.chinese: 蛋糕製造者無緣無故地用寒戰的耙子擺一條赤裸的蛇。

sentences.english: April and Corinnehad been gone from home for some time, so I had no way of knowing what they looked like.
sentences.chinese: 阿普里爾和科琳已離家多時，我無緣一睹她們的芳容。

sentences.english: Eto 'o's goal just Pobai but missed the first accident.
sentences.chinese: 剛剛進球破百的埃託奧卻意外無緣首發。

sentences.english: This can cause tests to fail gratuitously.
sentences.chinese: 這會導致測試無緣無故地失敗。

sentences.english: The cake dor shakes a naked snake dawn the quaking rake lacking sake.
sentences.chinese: 蛋糕製造者無緣無故地用抖動的耙子搖一條赤的蛇。

sentences.english: She sometimes angers with little or no provocation.
sentences.chinese: 她有時無緣無故就生氣。

sentences.english: I think starvation takes priority over hotwheels and barbies.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得飢餓使窮人無緣接觸到賽車和芭比娃娃。

sentences.english: My report of resignation was fall into abeyance without sake.
sentences.chinese: 我的辭職報告無緣無故被擱置了。

sentences.english: The desensitisation of young men to gratuitously violent sexual acts is happening.
sentences.chinese: 年輕人正對無緣由的性暴力行爲脫敏。

sentences.english: Africa will not reach the semifinals this time.
sentences.chinese: 非洲國家這次終與半決賽無緣。

sentences.english: The west will not thrive in this “new normal” economy.
sentences.chinese: 在這種“新常態”經濟下，西方將與繁榮無緣。

sentences.english: It has the power to bring a state of causeless love and limitless joy.
sentences.chinese: 它有這個力量帶來無緣由的愛與無限喜悅的狀態。

sentences.english: Books were beyond her interest--knowledge a sealed book.
sentences.chinese: 她對書本不感興趣，書本知識和她無緣。

sentences.english: See Wang Wenfang paintings, and classical people draw near miss.
sentences.chinese: 看王文芳的畫，和古文人畫近乎無緣。

sentences.english: Ray did not live to see the summer of year 2000, he passed away that spring at the age of fourteen.
sentences.chinese: 暐頌在他十四歲時去世，無緣見到公元二千年的夏天。

definition: to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
only/merely/nothing but/no more than/it's just that ...
in those days/then/in those years/during that time
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
